Case reference: 2013000051.CaseDesc: Darren Fortier was last seen hitchhiking in Port Hardy on the evening of December 30, 1998.  Mr. Fortier had been involved in a serious injury a few years earlier which had left him with a metal plate and pins in his leg and a brain injury.

Hat: Cotton, Blue, Maroon, Colorado Avalanche Baseball Cap
Scar: Chin, Distinct on the left side of chin
Cheek, Down the right side of the face
Nose, Across the bridge of the nose
Foreign Object: Left Thigh, Surgical Implant, Plate and 5 screws

Case reference: 2011005499.CaseDesc: Lukas was last seen on October 3, 2011, heading into the bushes behind Chomista Trailer park. His duffle bag was located in the bushes with his personal property on October 7, 2011. He was en route to his sister's place, but never arrived. Lukas has ties to Winnipeg and Calgary.

Case reference: 2006000699.CaseDesc:
On January 31, 1988, a male was found on the Don Valley Parkway, having jumped from the Bloor Street Viaduct in Toronto. He is described as a dark-skinned Caucasian. His post-mortem length was recorded as being approximately 5’5"-5'6", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living length due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  
He has a thick beard and moustache. He also has a significant amount of body hair. His appendix is present.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Thick receding hairline, bushy eyebrows
Teeth: Full set of natural teeth: exception of third molars. Amalgam fillings in some post. teeth, U-left lateral incisor is peg-shaped
Jacket: Leather, Brown, "House of Peerless" Winnepeg, Canada brand, size large,
Shirt: Long-sleeve salmon-coloured shirt with vertical blue stripes
Shoes: Grey leather shoes with rubber crepe soles
Underwear: Green, White band, "Watsons" brand, size large
Mark: Left Cheek, Large nevus (mole) on the left side of his face beside his nose.

Case reference: 2009003999.CaseDesc: At about 1 p.m. Robert Aho of North Bay left Land O’Lakes Cottages located in Martin River and headed west bound on Highway 64 towards Field. He was carrying a packsack and duffle bag and has not been in contact with his family since.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeved, Toronto Maple Leaf

Case reference: 2014005441.CaseDesc: On April 23, 2010, Roland Enabulele was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roland had taken a trip to Spain and has last spoken with his ex-wife on May 3. During that conversation, Roland advised her that he would be returning to Toronto on May 5, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014006218.CaseDesc: Lori Kasprick, who sometimes went by "Lovey", was last seen in the mid-1970s.  She was from Hilliard and going to school in Mundare when last seen.  Lori may have had ties to Tofield and Ryley.  Her grandparents lived in Holden at that time, and Lori could have made acquaintance with others her age when going to visit.

Case reference: 2017040791.CaseDesc: On the night of July 16, 2017, Thomas Burke was seen for the last time leaving his home in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Thomas had left after a family meeting over financial issues. It did not appear that he took anything with him.

Case reference: 2014036537.CaseDesc: On October 2nd, 2014, a vehicle was located abandoned at 53122 Range Road 194 in Yellowhead County, Alberta. Investigators concluded that Natasha Klok was an occupant of that vehicle and that she went into a nearby heavily forested area. Ms.Klok has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2014005289.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1989, Clara Charles was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. On that day, Clara and her husband were moving and had a friend come over to help them. Clara told her husband that she and her friend were going to bring their furniture to their new address in Brampton, Ontario, and were to return later that evening.

Case reference: 2014004103.CaseDesc: Michelle Gurney was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver at the St. James Community Society building on December 11, 1998. She was reported missing ten days later. Ms. Gurney was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and had mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014004181.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1984, Yves Jodouin was seen for the last time as he was dropped off at a venue in Ottawa, Ontario. Yves had received permission to leave the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario to attend a show. Later that evening, he had phoned his family to advise he would be running late.

Case reference: 2014005265.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Devon Moldowan was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Jasper, Alberta. It is believed that Devon left on foot, and may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Pants: Black, Patches with yellow and orange stitching; baggy
Tattoo: Chest, The words "I'll keep you here for all my"

Case reference: 2006021399.CaseDesc: On June 28, 2000, Charles Siljander was last seen at the Marina Park in Thunder Bay, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance reports state that Charles appeared to be confused, forgetful, and that he had lost a significant amount of weight. On September 15, 2000, Charles’ abandoned vehicle, a grey 1981 Chevy pickup truck, was located on a logging road south of Thunder Bay, and near the Canadian and American border.

Case reference: 2014005144.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2008, Esther De Kiewit was reported missing after her mail was not being picked up from the Post Office in Boston Bar, British Columbia. She led a transient lifestyle and was living in an abandoned travel trailer in a forested area outside of Boston Bar. Esther moved throughout the back country frequently and is believed to have last been at her trailer in April of 2008. Esther suffered from mental health issues and seizures.  She was known to dress entirely in black.

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1979, James Caraley was last seen when he went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda in Jasper, Alberta.

Case reference: 2020006647.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1980, Ophlin Facey was seen for the last time as she left the residence of her employer. During the time of her disappearance, Ophlin was a live-in house keeper, and it is possible she may have been heading to a party that day.

Case reference: 2016024223.CaseDesc: Joseph Amiro was last seen leaving the Queen Elizabeth II Health Sciences Centre in Halifax, Nova Scotia on May 1, 2016.  Mr. Amiro suffers from medical issues that require daily medication. He is known to wear glasses and walk with a cane. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 2014005555.CaseDesc: In April, 2000, Magdalena Ciesek was last seen in Toronto, Ontario at the intersection of Dundas Street W. and Roncesvalles Avenue.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001079.CaseDesc: On June 5, 1986, the skeletal remains of an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 18-29, were found in a wooded area near Hollyburn Mountain in Cypress Provincial Park in West Vancouver British-Columbia. He was likely not from the region and may have went missing between 1984 and 1985. He carried a small figure of Jurojin, an ancient Japanese god of fortune, and had a photo of the Buddha in his wallet. He would be about 60 years old today.

Jacket: Grey, HOODED, Hooded with front zipper

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2013000007.CaseDesc: Kimberly Ann McAndrew has been missing since August 12, 1989. At 4:20 p.m., she left the Canadian Tire where she was employed as a cashier. There were unconfirmed reports that Kimberly was last seen at the Gardenia Flower Shop in Penhorn Mall in Dartmouth. She was identified by an employee at the flower shop as having bought a balloon and a rose.

Shoes: Jade green, flat heeled slip on loafers

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2014001643.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1989, Diane Racicot was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Diana left a farewell letter in the family home. She left without a change of clothes and with very little money. Diane speaks four languages.

Case reference: 2014001757.CaseDesc: On January 12, 1987, Patricia Hutton was seen for the last time in the Saint-Léonard district of Montreal, Quebec. She had an appointment at a daycare center on the corner of Beaubien and Langelier for a job, but never attended. Patricia hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2014006123.CaseDesc: Michael Montgomery was last seen at his residence in Mississauga, Ontario on May 22, 2013. At the end of May 2013 Mr. Montgomery was spotted in the area of HWY 16, Jasper National Park, Alberta. It is possible that he was making his way towards Edmonton to look for work.

Case reference: 2013000133.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2013, Prince Edward OPP (Picton) were advised of a 30 ft sailboat that had run aground on the shores at Point Petre (Lake Ontario). It was determined that the sailboat was from Rochester, New York and had left the Chimney Bluff State Park Marina (New York) on July 13,  2013 in the morning. Based on GPS tracks the investigators suspect that Scott French went overboard in American waters, and the boat drifted into Canadian Waters.

Hair: Brown, Brush Cut, Balding at the front
Shoes: Leather, White, New Balance, Running shoe

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014005279.CaseDesc: Brian Guberman was reported missing in July 1974. Brian owned a black and yellow 1964 Volkswagon van that has never been located.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020149.CaseDesc: These partial skeletal remains were recovered 11 km south of Highway #1 on Greenstone Road in the Dominic Lake area, approximately 22 km west of Kamloops.

Case reference: 2013000108.CaseDesc: Roger Houle is missing from Montreal since July 12, 1996. Roger is hearing impaired and mute. He left his home without taking anything. He worked for 15 years at the same place and he never advised his employer that he would not be returning to work.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001524.CaseDesc: Matthew Leblanc was last seen by his sister on the morning of September 22, 1999, after he had coffee with her. Matthew was last observed at the bus stop located at the intersection of Superior/Menzies Street in Victoria. Matthew failed to attend an afternoon appointment and has not been heard or seen from since.

Case reference: 2005007399.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 20 to 40 years of age, was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-190 lbs and his length was measured at 5’7”-5’10”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Brown, Curly, Shoulder, Dark moustache
Teeth: He has multiple amalgam fillings and his wisdom teeth are fully erupted.
Chain: Gold, 20 inch, 10K gold, fine weave chain necklace.
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Reddish brown leather Olympian brand shoes (extra wide).
Pants: Blue, Plaid, Grand National Trousers brand, size 36
Underwear: Blue, White, Mentug brand briefs, size large

Case reference: 2010006499.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2007, Mark Brazau was reported missing by a friend.  Mark was last seen at his place of work in Toronto Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Short, Over ears, receding hairline, beard and a moustache

Case reference: 2006002999.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was located in a laneway behind 1556 Bloor Street West near Dundas Street in Toronto on March 21, 1997. He was thought to be a homeless person who frequented the area on a daily basis. Although he appears to be somewhat older, there are no arthritic changes to his bones, which are typical of older individuals. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Grey, White, Wavy, Medium length hair with a grey moustache and beard
Teeth: Poor dental hygiene with one restoration
Other: 750 ml bottle of Andres Golden Cream Canadian Sherry
Foreign Object: Right Ankle, plate and metal screws

Case reference: 2014006177.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1987, at approximately 9:00 p.m. Phillip Orvis went out onto the lake in his boat from Matheson Island. He was planning to go to his fishing camp at Black Bear Island. At the time that he left the water on the lake was very rough. Phillip could not swim and he was known to never wear a life jacket. His boat was found the next day drifted up against the mainland approximately 1/2 mile south east of the dock where he is believed to have left from. The boat was filled with water. Searches were conducted by land, air and water and dragging operations were conducted on the lake however his body was never located. Phillip Orvis is presumed dead due to drowning and foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2006014699.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1996, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Melanie Ethier was seen for the last time as she left a friend’s residence to walk to her residence in New Liskeard, Ontario. The distance between her home and her friend’s residence was a kilometre, but Melanie never arrived home. Foul play is suspected.

Shirt: Cotton, White, a blue heart ("Pepe" logo) t-shirt

Case reference: 2006016399.CaseDesc: Noriharu Amano was last seen on July 24, 2005 at the airport on Airport Road in Sault Ste. Marie. He left in a Cessna C-172 aircraft which had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red. The Cessna was last heard from as it was circling over Goulais Bay.

Case reference: 2014002462.CaseDesc: Michel Blanchette resided in north-Montreal and was seen for the last time on October 6, 1972. Late that evening, he went to "Taverne Duvernay" located on "Boulevard de la Concorde" in Laval where he went missing and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014001721.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2003, Luis Betancourt was seen for the last time when he left his home in St. Catharines, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Luis was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018063446.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1990, Ian MacKay was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Ian’s brother had not heard from him in three years before he reported him missing.

Case reference: 2014004157.CaseDesc: When last seen Mark Krostewitz may have been planning a trip to Europe, however, relatives in Europe have not seen or heard from him.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020167.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet. He was previously discovered as a stowaway on the vessel S.K. Junior that originated in Ningbo, China on March 15th, 1997 and arrived in Vancouver April 4th, 1997.

Teeth: Stained, Poor oral hygiene and forensic analysis identified many unique characteristics in his dentition.
Jacket: Synthetic, Blue, Red, blue and white track suit jacket with stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002360.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1996, Benoit Lachance was seen for the last time in the Pointes-Aux-Trembles District in Montreal, Quebec. Benoit was a member of a motorcycle club called the "Rowdy Crew" and drove a blue Chevrolet Camaro.

Scar: Middle Back, Bullet still in the back

Case reference: 2014002401.CaseDesc: Jane was a student at Laurentian University in Sudbury, Ontario. She was last seen on August 9, 1975, in her apartment just before she went to bed at 2:00 a.m. The next day she was not seen or heard from, and was reported missing. Her personal belongings were left behind. It appears that Jane may have been a victim of foul play.

Scar: Forehead, Small round scare between the eyebrows.

Case reference: 2022019161.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2022, James Logan was seen for the last time in Stony Plain, Alberta. That same day, James had called a friend for a ride, and was later dropped off at the Rotary Park in Stony Plain. When James left his residence, he did not take any of his personal belongings, including his wallet, glasses, medication, cellphone, and vehicle.

Case reference: 2012020114.CaseDesc: Sebastien Metivier went missing in Montreal on November 1, 1984. The young boy was in front of the Tres-Saint-Nom-de-Jesus church on the east side of the city. He was heading to an arts and crafts course.

Pants: Blue, Patch on the right knee

Case reference: 2014003345.CaseDesc: Tom Dobrowolsky was last seen leaving his Richmond, British Columbia, residence on February 21, 1981. Tom was originally from Montreal, Quebec, and had previously lived in various provinces across Canada.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Both upper eye teeth are missing
Mark: Mouth, Both upper eye teeth are missing
Scar: Left Leg, Varicose vein scars on both legs

Case reference: 2019040389.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2019, a rib bone belonging to a male wrapped in a t-shirt was recovered by a fisherman in the waters of the Strait of Georgia near Gibsons, British Columbia.

Shirt: Beige, Two eagles with "Gibsons, British Columbia, Canada" printed on the front

Case reference: 2006012699.CaseDesc: John James Semple lived in a retirement home on Yearly Road, Huntsville, Ontario.  He was last seen in Huntsville in January 1998.

Case reference: 2014004459.CaseDesc: In the late summer of 1998, Charles Trottier was last seen by his family on the Kehewin Cree First Nations Reserve, near Bonneville, Alberta. Charles may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2020011563.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1988, at approximately 12:00pm, Mosses Korman was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018053572.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1996, Maymuna Mohamid was seen for the last time by her brother and sister-in-law in Toronto, Ontario. When her brother returned home, Maymuna and all her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2017010385.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Fadi Zakir was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005998.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2013, Joshua Miller was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Purple shirt with black stripes

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001219.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1994, the remains of a man were found in Cates Park in North Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had a healed fracture to his right wrist and may have had an old injury to the lower back. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.  Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Belt: Beige, Khaki, webbed with brass buckle

Case reference: 2014003839.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1988, George Leslie was seen for the last time at his residence in the city of St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, George was despondent. His vehicle was subsequently located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002505.CaseDesc: On January 27, 1988, Lisa Somerton was seen for the last time outside of her residence located at 1220 Merivale Road in Ottawa, Ontario. She was observed approaching a black sports car with two people inside.

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2021006090.CaseDesc: At the end of July, 2019, Jonathan Fowler was seen for the last time in Picton, Ontario. Since then, there has not been any activity on his banking, phone and social media accounts. During the time of his disappearance, Jonathan was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2012020036.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2009, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Monique Mattar was seen for the last time in the northeast community of Greenview in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Monqiue was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2012020094.CaseDesc: Gordon Harvey was last seen on July 24, 2008, at approximately 2130 hours. He was swimming in the Saskatchewan River near Cranberry Flats, south of Saskatoon, SK. Personal clothing and articles of identification belonging to Mr. Harvey were recovered on the shore near where he was last seen swimming.

Case reference: 2014006541.CaseDesc: Roxanne Fleming has not been seen since approximately 1986.  Around the time of last contact, she spent time in Lillooet, BC, Kamloops, BC, Vancouver, BC, Red Deer, AB, and Edmonton, AB.  The circumstances of her disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2014001381.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1982, Patricia Elizabeth Flynn was last seen running away from her family residence in a densely wooded area near her home in Yarrow, British-Colombia. Patricia was despondent and had medical issues that required attention at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2020020791.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2020, David was supposed to cross into Tucson, Arizona from Nogales, Mexico, unfortunately he has not been heard from since. Last contact was made around midnight between May 12 and 13, 2020.

Case reference: 2014004752.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2005 a man attended the Victoria Police Department and reported not seeing Belinda Cameron for over one month.  He told police Belinda had mentioned wanting to visit relatives in Vancouver and Manitoba but did not provide names to police.  This man reported sharing an intimate relationship with Belinda outside of his own marriage.  He said she was not a habitual runaway.  This man denied harming Belinda and through a Polygraph examination was determined to be honest.  The Victoria Police investigated Belinda's disappearance and determined that Belinda suffered from a mental illness, had a drug addiction and may have been a sex trade worker.  The last confirmed sighting of Belinda was at Shoppers Drug Mart at 870 Esquimalt Rd.  She failed to attend thereafter to pick up her daily medication.

Hair: Black, Long, Separated in the middle

Case reference: 2006026399.CaseDesc: Kathy Anne Lulloff was last seen wandering off into the woods off Seabrook Lake Road in the District of Algoma.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: On January 20, 1983, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Tania Murrell was seen for the last time as she left school to return home.

Case reference: 2020024219.CaseDesc: On the night of July 6, 2020, Richard Kocik left his residence in Wasaga Beach, Ontario on foot. Richard left his wallet and personal identification behind. Richard has a history of walking away from his residence due to mental health issues similar to dementia. He has always been located after a few days. There was an extensive search conducted to locate Richard which yielded negative results.

Hair: Black, Grey, Salt and pepper hair colour
Tattoo: Left Chest, Heart shaped thumb print
Left Forearm, Footprint with the name "Ryan"

Case reference: 2014005045.CaseDesc: William MORGAN was last seen during the early morning hours of October 28, 1968, at a cabin near Moose Mountain Provincial Park, approximately 12km north of Arcola, SK. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. MORGAN was planning to go out hunting in the area for deer. He had no vehicle and had a slow deliberate walk. A 30-30 rifle was also found to be missing from the cabin. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Mr. MORGAN.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, blue flag and eagle

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2008020199.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1973, Donald MacGregor was seen for the last time in Miami, Florida, after leaving for a business trip to Panama City in Panama.

Case reference: 2008002599.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1991, William Caswell and his daughter were boating on Panache Lake when they were both suddenly thrown into the water. Mr. Caswell's daughter managed to swim ashore but William is still missing and is presumed drowned. Panache Lake is located east of Espanola and West of Sudbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2012020100.CaseDesc: On June 29, 2006, the remains of a Caucasian woman were discovered in an old well in Saskatoon, SK.  Her remains appear to have been there for many decades.  There are injuries on the remains that suggest she may have been a victim of foul play.

Skirt: Cotton, Black, White, poplin skirt, ruffled edge with silk bodice
Underwear: Cotton, White, pre-1920 corset with stays
Boots: Leather, Black, ladies-front lace up pointed toe, circa 1910

Case reference: 2014001410.CaseDesc: Emma Dixon was last seen on July 22, 1964 at her home on Union Bar Reserve, in Hope, British Columbia. Her husband said that she may have gone to Washington for work. Emma never told anyone she was leaving and did not take any personal belongings. She was reported missing on August 20, 1964.

Case reference: 2019062920.CaseDesc: In 1975, Louise Laderoute was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Louise had been residing at her parents’ home and it is believed that she went missing after leaving their residence.

Scar: Left Cheek, Facial scar from the cheek to the corner of the mouth.

Case reference: 2006021699.CaseDesc: Karl Anderson was last seen on September 3, 1974 in Upsala, Ontario. It was thought that he possibly travelled by train to Sioux Lookout or Thunder Bay to seek medical treatment.

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018045820.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1994, at approximately 1:30 pm, Subarangit Rajanehru was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2014004979.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2007, Gad Krespine, a resident of Montreal, was last seen at approximately 10:30 am at 1755 Lierre Street in Laval, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002212.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1996, Betty Primeau was last seen while berry picking in the Torch River area near Choiceland, SK. Mrs. Primeau was with a group of other individuals prior to being reported missing. Extensive searches have failed to locate Mrs. Primeau.

Case reference: 2005002399.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1984, an unidentified Caucasian female was found in a ditch near Napanee, Ontario, approximately five kilometers south of the Village of Newburgh and four kilometers north of the Palace Road exit from Highway #401. She was estimated to have been there for 2-5 months.

Hair: Blonde, Dark blonde hair, shorter than collar with moderate curl
